definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You never know out of the mouths of babes and sucklings , remember.
sentences.chinese: 谁知道，不过别忘了，黄口孺子往往能说出至理名言。

sentences.english: His enchantment comes from his childlike pureness and sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 其魅力缘于他的赤子般“纯念”和孺子般“真诚”。

sentences.english: I'm willing to be an ox serving the country all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我甘当孺子牛，终生为国家服务。

sentences.english: I am worthy of being taught.
sentences.chinese: 我也算是孺子可教了吧。

sentences.english: At last DM. A truly interesting fascinating article.
sentences.chinese: 本站终于孺子可教，一篇真正有趣吸引人的文章。

definition: Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
Master/(old form of address for teachers, scholars)/pedant
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
Shun (c. 23rd century BC), mythical sage and leader
